captions.text: [MUSIC - CHARITY VANCE, "ICING"]
-Hey everyone.

You are going to be so
excited because today,

we are going to teach a
new Valentine's hairdo.

So one of my favorites
are the Valentine's dos,

and so we've donned our
Valentine attire today just
for this video.

And this one we're going to
call twist-braided heart.
And you will love it.

So I like this one because it's
a little bit older and more

sophisticated
version of the heart.

On her-- I'm going
to flip it around

so you can see-- you
can see she has bangs,
so we've left those out.

And she also has a lot of
layers in her hair, which

is perfect for any of
you that have layers.

And I have parted her
hair down the middle.

And then I have just parted
it over towards her ear

to make a little
triangular section,
and there's two of them.

And then you're just going
to pull all of this back,
just really softly.

And if you're going
for more grown up,

sophisticated look, then you
can also tease this quite a bit,
if you want to.
And then start a basic braid.

Now, the only
trick to this braid

is you want to try to get
as close to the middle part
as you can.
I didn't like that sectioning.

So make sure you
just try to bring
it as close to the middle part.

And you'll understand
why in just a second.
So this is really simple.
Just a basic braid.
Nothing super fancy.
Braid it.

And when you're done,
secure it with an elastic.

And your hair doesn't have
to be very long, either,

to do this one--
just long enough

for probably six
inches of braid.

And you can see now that we
have these two braids that

are just close to
that middle part.

Now this is where
the twist comes in.

You're just going
to take each braid
and give it a little twist.

And then I'm going
to take a bobby pin

and secure that little
flippy right there.

And we're going to
do it on each side.

Just take this one and twist
it to the opposite direction.

Can you see we're forming our
little-- the little curves
of the heart?
And bobby pin this one.

And then I'm just going
to simply bring those ends

together and undo
these elastics.

And I'm just going to literally
put them back together

and let the rest of
the hair fall down.
Go back and hide that pin.
So there you go.
Simple, simple.

What do you think
of this hairdo?

-I like it because it
feels secure and super cute
for Valentine's Day.

-I think a little
ribbon-- I think

a bow would be
amazing on this one.
I love that it's so soft.

Leave the bangs down and
loose and you're ready to go.
So here is the finished look.

You can see this so
cute little heart.

And you can envision-- I
just had a ribbon bow here
at the house today.
You can put one there.

I still think a
fabric heart would
be the most adorable thing ever.

I'm going to have to
go buy some fabric

hearts so I have one
for Valentine's Day.
Check it out.

If you click in
this playlist below,

you guys will find a whole
series of other Valentine's
hairdos we've done in the past.
You'll love them.

Some of them include
the love piggies

for short hair, the hanging
heart, the lace braid heart.
They're all great.

I think we've all loved using
them for Valentine's Day.
-Yeah.

-And I'm sure you're
going to get a lot
compliments if you use them.

Check them out and then
leave a comment telling me
which one is your favorite.

And we will see
you guys next week.
Bye bye.
[MUSIC - CHARITY VANCE, "ICING"]

title: Twist-Braided Heart | Valentines Day Hairstyles | Cute Girls Hairstyles

comments.text:
